intro: Henckelia gambleana, commonly known as the Gambles' henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in mountainous areas, preferring cool and moist environments. It features delicate, umbrella-like clusters of small white or pale pink flowers. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role within its native habitat.
